title: Visualization designer
description: I create interactive graphics and software that accurately convey information to the human visual system, telling audience-appropriate stories about patterns that exist within or between datasets

title: Data wrangler
description: I experiment with, identify, and reshape data to fit appropriate data models that are effective for relevant stakeholders to understand and query, and are efficient for algorithms to leverage

title: Product manager
description: I identify, document, and communicate diverse stakeholder high-level goals, and how they justify low-level interactive tasks, software features, designs, and data models

title: UX designer / researcher
description: I experiment with, plan, test, and analyze the extent to which software (and/or hardware) systems are useful, usable, expressive, learnable, and compatible with real-world workflows

title: Front-end developer
description: I build, test, deploy, adapt, and maintain user-facing, interactive software that behaves according to stakeholder needs

title: Graphic designer
description: I experiment with, plan, and implement visual layouts, styles, typography that achieve a purpose, are aesthetically pleasing, and fit stakeholder needs

title: Technical writer / communicator
description: I write text, create figures, and animations or videos that communicate technical information at an appropriate level of detail for a specific audience

title: Business ethnographer
description: I use rigorous qualitative research methodologies to discover blind spots in current strategies and articulate under-explored questions with enough detail to make them more actionable

title: Back-end developer
description: I build, test, desploy, adapt, and maintain infrastructure that deals with heavy computations, secure data storage and retrieval, communication between users, etc.

title: Data scientist
description: Fancy term for "statistician;" I understand, design, and implement AI / Machine Learning algorithms to model and predict phenomena

title: Bioinformatician
description: I am prepared to play all of the other listed roles, in the context of biological (and often sensitive human) data
